workflow.name: Extract & approve tasks from Telegram to Notion with Gemini AI & voice support
workflow.description:
This workflow automatically converts Telegram text or voice messages into Notion tasks by using AI to extract the task name and due date, allowing users to approve or decline tasks directly in Telegram before they are created. It is designed for students managing assignments, professionals tracking tasks from messaging apps, productivity enthusiasts looking to automate task entry, and teams using Notion for organized task management.

---

## Detailed Use Case

This template turns casual Telegram messages and voice notes into confirmed Notion tasks by handling transcription, AI extraction, validation, and user approval. Typical scenarios include:

- **Students:** Record or type assignment details after class ‚Üí transcribe, extract title + due date ‚Üí confirm ‚Üí save to Notion.  
- **Managers:** Capture meeting action items in chat ‚Üí extract tasks and deadlines ‚Üí verify with one tap ‚Üí add to project database.  
- **Freelancers:** Log client requests by voice ‚Üí confirm parsed due date ‚Üí create a tracked task in Notion.  
- **Productivity users / teams:** Quickly funnel ad-hoc requests from Telegram into a single Notion workspace without manual copy/paste.

Key benefits: automated transcription, structured extraction (TaskName + TaskDue), quick user approval in Telegram, and reliable Notion mapping for immediate tracking.

---

## Prerequisites for this Workflow

- **n8n instance**  
  - Active and publicly reachable for webhook triggers.

- **Telegram bot**  
  - Create via **BotFather**, copy **Bot Token**, and get **chat ID**.

- **Transcription API**  
  - I use **Google Gemini Free Tier**, but you can use **Groq, OpenAI**, or any other provider.  
  - Add your API key / credentials in n8n.

- **Notion integration & database**  
  - Integration token added to n8n.  
  - Database structure must include:  
    - **Title** (Title property) ‚Üí Task Name  
    - **Date** (Date property) ‚Üí Task Due Date  
  - Share the database with the integration and copy the **Database ID**.

- **n8n node setup basics**  
  - Telegram Trigger node for messages.  
  - Telegram Get File node (**Download = true**) for voice notes.  
  - Transcription node connected to your chosen provider.  
  - AI Extractor node to get `TaskName` and `TaskDue`.  
  - Notion node with mapped properties (TaskName ‚Üí Title, TaskDue ‚Üí Date).

---

For any doubts or questions, contact: `contact@abhiman.io` or connect on LinkedIn: `https://www.linkedin.com/in/abhimangs/`

workflow.name: Voice agent for the notion tasks through the telegram

attributes.name: TaskName
attributes.description: The title of the task. Only return a value if it clearly exists; otherwise, leave empty.

attributes.name: TaskDue
attributes.description: The due date of the task. Only return a value if clearly present; otherwise, leave empty.

parameters.message:
=Task Name: {{ $json.output.TaskName }}
Due Date: {{ new Date($json.output.TaskDue).toLocaleDateString('en-US', { year: 'numeric', month: 'short', day: 'numeric' }) }}

parameters.text: =Title or due date cannot be extracted. Please try again.

parameters.content:
## üí¨ Telegram: Receive Message  
Triggers when a new Telegram message arrives either text or voice and sends the data forward for processing.

## üîÄ Switch: Text or Voice  
Checks if the message is text or voice and routes it to the matching branch.

## ‚úèÔ∏è Set: Prepare Text  
Extracts the text message from Telegram and stores it for later processing.

## üéôÔ∏è Voice Processing Chain  
1. **Telegram: Download Voice File:** Downloads the user's voice message from Telegram.  
2. **Gemini: Transcribe Voice:** Sends the downloaded audio to Google Gemini and transcribes it into text.
3. **Set: Put Transcript into Text:** Stores the transcribed text for further use in the workflow.  

üîÑ Together, these nodes convert voice messages into usable text for automation.

## üß† Task Information Extraction  
1. **Google Gemini Chat Model** ‚Äì Powers the AI extraction with Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite.  
2. **AI Extractor: TaskName & TaskDue** ‚Äì Identifies and extracts the *task title* and *due date* from the provided text.  

‚úÖ Converts user text into structured task data for Notion or any task system.

## ‚úÖ Validate Task Extraction
1. **If: Extraction Valid?** ‚Äì Checks if both `TaskName` and `TaskDue` exist from the AI-extracted output.  
2. **Telegram: Notify - Extraction Failed** ‚Äì Sends a Telegram message to the user if extraction fails: "Title or due date cannot be extracted. Please try again."  

üí° Ensures only valid tasks proceed and notifies users when extraction is incomplete.

## üì© Ask for Task Approval
- **Telegram: Ask Approve / Decline** ‚Äì Sends a message with the extracted `TaskName` and `TaskDue` to the user.  
- Provides **Approve** and **Decline** buttons for double approval.  

üí° Lets users quickly confirm or reject tasks directly via Telegram.

## ‚úÖ Check Task Approval
- **Approval Check (If Approved?)** ‚Äì Checks if the user approved the task in Telegram.
- **Telegram: Notify - Task Not Created** ‚Äì Notifies the user if the task was declined.

## üìù Create Task in Notion
- **Notion: Create Task Page** ‚Äì Adds a new page in Notion with the extracted task name and due date.
- **Telegram: Notify - Task Created** ‚Äì Confirms to the user that the task was successfully created.

# Quick Setup Checklist ‚Äî Telegram ‚Üí Transcribe ‚Üí Extract ‚Üí Notion

## 1) Telegram (BotFather)
- Create a bot with **BotFather** ‚Üí `/newbot` ‚Üí copy the **Bot Token**.
- Start the bot in your Telegram app (send any message to it).
- **Get your chat ID**:
  - Easiest: send a message to the bot, open the **Telegram Trigger** in n8n and check the incoming `chat.id`.
  - Or use `getUpdates` with your bot token to read the latest `chat.id`.
- Keep the Bot Token and one example `chat.id` handy for n8n credentials/testing.

## 2) Google Gemini (transcription)
- Create a Google Cloud project and enable the **GenAI / PaLM (Gemini)** API.
- Note: use trial credits or free tier for testing if available.
- In n8n: add Gemini (Google Palm) credentials under **Credentials**.

## 3) Notion (integration + database)
- Create a Notion integration and copy its **Integration Token**.
- Create a **Notion database** for tasks with at least:
  - **Title** ‚Äî (Title) ‚Äî for the task name
  - **Date** ‚Äî (Date) ‚Äî for the due date
- Share the database with your integration (Share ‚Üí invite integration).
- Copy the **Database ID** from the database URL.

## 4) Map extracted values to Notion (simple instruction ‚Äî no code)
- In the **Notion: Create Task Page** node, map the extractor output using the UI:
  - **Title** ‚Üí map the extracted **TaskName** to the Notion Title.
  - **Date** ‚Üí map the extracted **TaskDue** to the Notion Date property.
- Use the node's right-side input panel to pick values from `AI Extractor: TaskName & TaskDue`.

## 5) Audio / Transcription notes (Gemini handles transcription)
- Set **Telegram Get File** node to **Download = true** so the node provides binary.
- Pass the downloaded binary into the **Gemini: Transcribe Voice** node (inputType = binary).
- Gemini will transcribe the audio (no external converter required with this setup).
- If you ever see format issues, confirm the Telegram binary is passed to Gemini (download=true).

## 6) n8n required credentials (add these in n8n)
- Telegram API (Bot Token)  
- Google Gemini (Google Palm) API credentials  
- Notion Integration Token

## 7) Final quick tests
- **Text test:** send a plain text task to the bot ‚Üí extractor ‚Üí approval ‚Üí create Notion page.
- **Voice test:** send a voice note ‚Üí Gemini transcribes ‚Üí extractor ‚Üí approval ‚Üí create Notion page.
- If extraction fails, check the **If: Extraction Valid?** node and confirm the Notion mapping.

---

**Done.** Map TaskName ‚Üí Title and TaskDue ‚Üí Date in the Notion node using the UI (drag/select). If Notion shows the date wrong, tell me and I‚Äôll give a one-line fix.

user.name: Abhiman
user.bio: Automation consultant helping creators and small teams streamline their workflows using Notion and n8n. I build systems that save time, boost productivity, and keep everything running smoothly. Check my LinkedIn to connect or collaborate on custom automations.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
